## Cost of Debt: YTM and After-Tax Adjustment A bond with face value \$1000, **coupon rate = 6.9**% (annual), **price = \$936**, and **maturity = 5** years. Compute the **approximate YTM**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ **Idea:** The YTM is the bondholder’s **required return** if coupons are reinvested at the same rate. A handy approximation is: YTM ≈ (Coupon + (FV − Price)/n) ÷ ((FV + Price)/2). **Your numbers:** ≈ (69 + (1000 − 936)/5) ÷ ((1000 + 936)/2) = **8.45%**.
::: If the **corporate tax rate** is **31**%, compute the **after-tax cost of debt**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ **Why lower after tax?** Interest is tax-deductible, so the effective cost is **Rd × (1 − T)**. **Your numbers:** 8.45% × (1 − 31%) = **5.83%**.
:::
